intro: Tephrosia vohimenaensis, commonly known as the Madagascar tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to the island's unique ecological conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in shades of yellow or white. Tephrosia vohimenaensis plays a role in local ecosystems and may have traditional uses by indigenous communities.
